Eligiblity: A candidate who has passed the Higher Secondary or Plus Two examination recognized by the Mahatma Gandhi University or any other examination recognized as equivalent there to and has secured not less than fifty percent of the marks in the aggregate in such examinations shall be eligible to be considered for admission.
Course_Detail: Bachelor of Arts + Bachelor of Laws (BA LLB) is five-years (10 Semesters) full-time Integrated programme in Law offered by Mahatma Gandhi University, Kottayam with the approval of Bar Council of India.

Eligiblity: A candidate seeking admission should be a graduate of Mahatma Gandhi University or any other University recognized as equivalent there to by the Mahatma Gandhi University. The minimum marks required are not less than fifty percent in the aggregate. For Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe candidates the minimum marks required is forty-five percent in the aggregate.
Course_Detail: Bachelor of Laws (LLB) is three-years (6 Semesters ) full-time program offered by Mahatma Gandhi University, Kottayam and approved by Bar Council of India.

Eligiblity: A candidate who has passed the LL.B Examination of the Mahatma Gandhi University, or of any other University recognized as equivalent thereto and has secured not less than 55% of the marks in the aggregate shall be eligible to be considered for admission. For SC/ST candidates, the minimum marks required is 50% in the aggregate
Course_Detail: Master of Laws (LL.M.) is Duration of 2 years (Four Semesters) program affiliated with Mahatma Gandhi University, Kottayam an approved by Bar Council of India.

Eligiblity: 10+2 or equivalent examination from a recognized Board with a minimum of 45% marks in aggregate (40% marks for SC/ST candidates).
Course_Detail: It is essential for a graduate of law to have a robust understanding of the social sciences. Law and social sciences share a strong mutual relationship. While a legal instrument is a mechanism to express the socio-economic and political will of the State, it is equally undeniable that the effectiveness of the legal system has a definite impact on the society. Hence a successful attorney should have a sound knowledge of the social sciences in order to appreciate how to use law as an instrument of social change. The B.A. LL. B. (Hons.) course at the Alliance School of Law includes Political Science, Sociology, Economics, and English subjects as minor areas of study to supplement the wide range of law subjects that its graduates are require

Eligiblity: LL. B./B. L. or any other graduate degree in Law recognized by Bar Council of India with a minimum of minimum 45% marks in aggregate (40% in case of candidate belonging to reserved category).
Course_Detail: The Master of Law degree course prepares graduates at the postgraduate level in legal principles, law, justice, and governance while building in them strong research acumen and subject matter expertise in Constitutional and Administrative Law as well as Corporate and Commercial Law. Eligiblity: LL.B with 50% marks (45% for SC/ST/PH) from recognized University.
Course_Detail: Master of Laws is full time two year course degree offered by Babasaheb Bhimrao Ambedkar University, Lucknow and approved by Bar Council of India.

Eligiblity: LL.B with 50% marks (45% for SC/ST/PH) from recognized University.
Course_Detail: Master of Laws in Human Rights is full time two year course degree offered by Babasaheb Bhimrao Ambedkar University, Lucknow and approved by Bar Council of India.

Eligiblity: Candidates who are appearing or have appeared in the 10+2 examination and are awaiting results are also eligible to appear in the test. However, such candidates are required to have passed the qualifying examination at the time of their admission and must be able to submit proofs in support of their claims. No provisional admission shall be provided to those candidates who are not submitting the result of the qualifying examination (i.e. 10+2) at the time of admission.
